# send(_:to:completion:)

**Instance Method**

Sends a standard data object to other participants in the group session.

## Declaration

```swift
final func send(_ value: Data, to participants: Participants = .all, completion: @escaping ((any Error)?) -> Void)
```

## Parameters

- **participants**: The recipients of the message. The default value of this parameter is the set of all active participants in the session. Use the [doc://com.apple.GroupActivities/documentation/GroupActivities/Participants/only(_:)-swift.enum.case] option to specify a subset of participants.
- **completion**: The handler block to call with the results of the delivery attempt. The handler has no return value and takes a single Error parameter. The value of this parameter is `nil` if delivery succeeds; otherwise, it contains an appropriate error object.

## Discussion

Use this method to send data using a standard data object. Your app is responsible for decoding and using the data it receives.

## Sending data to the group

- **send(_:to:)**: Sends a standard data object asynchronously to other participants in the group session.
- **send(_:to:)**: Sends a custom type asynchronously to other participants in the group session.
- **send(_:to:completion:)**: Sends a custom type to other participants in the group session.
- **Participants**: The set of participants to include in messages.
